question_text: A user is replacing an old HDD with a new SSD. Which approach offers the fastest way to preserve all existing files and settings?
answer_options: Performing a clean OS install and manually copying files
Cloning the old drive to the new SSD
Installing the new drive without formatting
Exporting browser bookmarks and copying select folders
correct_answer: Cloning the old drive to the new SSD
explanation: Cloning ensures that everything — OS, files, applications — is copied in one step to the new drive.
